intro: Palicourea mexiae, commonly known as Mexican palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Palicourea mexiae is often found in the understory of these forests, where it thrives in the humid climate.
